subtitles.transcript: If I were to label one thing as the UC affordability crisis, it would be that no one
seems to recognize what the actual problem is and the actual problem is that it’s the low-income students who are
disproportionately bearing the burden of debt. In fact all the rhetoric that’s out there is about middle-income students.
“We need a middle class scholarship, middle-income families are being turned away.” And I think we have to recognize that
our state Cal Grant, the institutional grant program, are doing a lot, but they’re not doing enough.
